reviewText:
Author's note: My play time on Steam does not reflect my actual play time. There was an issue with the game keeping track of the play hours. This bug has since been fixed.

Author's note: I wrote a negative review about this game earlier. It actually compelled one of the owners to contact me so we could discuss some things. Because of this, some complaints were actually fixed or improved!


Do I recommend this game? That is a really tough call. As it stands, I VERY HESITANTLY recommend this game.


There is a lot to like about this game.

First, there is no shortage of items whatsoever. Many are quest items. Many can be equipped. Some are totally useless! In fact, there are so many items that it can be confusing!

Second, there are a fair number of classes to pick from and many items that each class can equip. Each class has its own perks and flaws.

Third, there are job classes a person can pick from. For example, I am a blacksmith.

Fourth, there are plenty of monsters to fight. Each one has its own sprite.

Fifth, there is a decent sized world to explore.

Sixth, there are a lot of quests in the game. Apparently there is an overarching quest in the game as well.

Seventh, the music for the game is pretty good.

Eighth, there are minigames as well!


However, there are some drawbacks with the game as well.

First, the game's store on their website is a tad distressing. There are items in the store that you can buy automatically. The good news about that though is that you can also get those items in game. There are really expensive quick levels" that you can buy in the store as well. $100 will max your character's level and his skills. Although I understand that hosting a game server costs money
date: I think being able to buy levels is kind of crummy. One of the owners and I talked this over. We both understood each others opinion.\n\nSecond of all
recommended: the community really sucks. Think a bunch of 20 year olds acting like a bunch of 12 year olds. No maturity. No accountability. Nothing. A big part of this game is the pvp factor. With pvp comes drama. With drama comes name calling and swearing. They have a right to say those things
hoursPlayed: sure. This is not a children's game or community.\n\nNOTE: There is a swear filter for the game
voteText: but is not working at the moment. One of the owners was alerted to this because of my other review and said it would be fixed.\n\nThird
helpfulPercent: there isn't much direction in the game. I'm okay when a game doesn't hold my hand
votesHelpful: but they ploped me into a world and I had no idea what I was doing. One of the owners and I talked it over and they are seeing what they can do to help newer players more. From my understanding
votesTotal: there is a larger quest that needs to be done. I think it's sort of like a puzzle where you need to go off to one place
column16: who will give you an item
column17: to take it to another person to give you another item
column19: after 10 hours of playing this game
column20: I still have yet to find the starting point of it.\n\nFourth
column21: people in this game are solid. You can't walk through them. So if someone wanted to block a path and not be afk
column23: they totally could. This can be useful for quests and pvp
column24:
but it could also be abused.


After speaking to one of the owners
column25: I realized that they really do care about the community and new players. The idea for this game is cool. The execution of it needs some work. However
column26: I think this game might really turn into something great."
column30: 68 of 81 people (84%) found this review helpful 6 people found this review funny

reviewText:
A lot of people seem to have trouble with bugs and such. Didn't have any of those, game worked right away.
It did take about half an hour before I had a clue of what I was doing, things are explained at the beginning but you have to pay attention to the chat box! Anyhow.. once I continued playing it felt a little repetitive, mostly because I had just one attack button to spam.

It felt a bit like I was playing a mix between tibia and runescape. I have to say, the music of this game is pretty darn awesome. And it has some potential, I didn't have any magic yet, and heard someone say in chatbox there whasn't any yet. But once this is included, it should make the atck-spam button, obsolete. There is also Lumberjacking, Mining and Fishing, to train proffesions like blacksmithing.

There is plenty to do for now, but also plenty to be implemented into the game, mostly things which will make the endgame much more enjoyable. So for now, you can play, test it out and help the community grow. Having some fun with an oldschool style rpg. Hacking and Slashing, to get your loots and buy that awesome weapon you always wanted..

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JR_FqeV92C4

reviewText:
Played this game well before Steam ever existed.

It's just old school fun, otherwise don't expect much else.

Majority of the game is open world PvP, focus is pretty much PvP.

The magic and skills are functional.

This game is on life support but it always survives.
It has died, risen, been executed, buried, dug out, resuscitated, and now put back together in some form that players from the original days won't even recognize the game now.

But somehow.. it just won't ever die. So be a part of what is immortal!

reviewText:
I'm going to start off by saying that if you don't like Retro RPG's/MMO's then this game is not for you.

However if you really enjoy Retro style MMORPG's, this game might strike your interest.

I had a lot of fun playing this game and it brings back a lot of nostalgia from my UO days.  It has a very small yet tight community, a lot of the old players all know eachother.

Everyone has been very helpful as well.  There are plenty of high-end players here answering questions and guiding noobs in the right direction.

Not to mention this game could run on a potatoe,  I really like it.  Don't listen to all the bad reviews because they are mainly from people who don't enjoy this style of game.  Give it a shot and see for yourself.

reviewText:
Just highlighting my problems with the game, there are great things about this game too. I am just not going to get into them.

The game is alright. Couldn't launch it from my library, if you have this problem then go to the directory of the game and right-click a file called ody.exe and run that as an administrator. You should be able to play the game then.

The games controls were very vague since I believe that there was no tutorial and there is no options to actually change your keys, only set macros. The only recognition of the controls was a stool which said Basic Commands" above it after you had to slay several rats and several wizards?"

reviewText:
Very old school game, hard to learn in the beggining and... hard to master quest making / boss killing / player killing. You definetly need to put  both time and dedication on this game.

The graphics are very simple, but the combat system is actually much more advanced than similar games, like tibia or runescape, which pretty much consist on face taking everything and spamming spells. On Odyssey, you can only facetank monsters from early levels and noob quests, on harder quests you have to fight monsters with extreme technique (hit them without getting hit), and same works for PVP.

Lots of fun with chat, random events and exploring in general. This game is one of a kind.

reviewText: It's beautiful that even in 2015 little indie gems like this can still rise to the surface on the steam marketplace. The large community of over 4 players is still as friendly as you could possibly wish for in any online community today. The catchy midi music, retro questing system, and innovative dynamic aspect ratio" feature really pull what is already a masterpiece together.\n\nThis is truly the pinnacle of human achievement
date: the peak of what was previously thought to be an insurmountable mountain that is somehow supposed to represent the ever increasing quality of pc games
recommended: the culmination of everything the video games industry has achieved since Gabe Yamauchi freed the world from the tyrannical clutches of the lizard nazis using a army of tiny Famicon powered robots in 1968.\n\nJust think about what you are about to experience as you watch the "CodeMallet Updater" work its magic doing whatever it is that it does to your system. Soon you will bask in the glory that is Odyssey Reborn... Or you won't
hoursPlayed: and the game will just crash on launch. Because clearly our current technology just isn't powerful enough to handle it."
voteText: March 30, 2015

reviewText: June 8th, 2015, game runs just fine on windows 8.1, very smoothly, no failure to launch, no crash issues. It is noted in the game news the launch had some issues. Nothing seems to be wrong now. Posting exclusively this to counteract some of the older reviews that state the game doesn't run.\n\nNot far enough in yet to say much, but so far it feels like your classic text-driven visual RPG in all the right ways, including light banter from NPCs, easy to navigate menus (unlike some games back in the day), and everyone's favorite click-to-investigate function. Will update when more is played!
